item.title: The Making of an Analyst: A Supplement to What Makes a Good Business Analyst
item.description:
I once commented the entry, What Makes a Good Business Analyst by Rajan Chandras, with an easy tone, If You Can Make it Here, You Can Make it Anywhere. The standards of a good analyst conclude by Rajan, in my opinion, are somewhat of very high bars.

<div>
  <span style="font-family: Arial;"> </span>
</div>

<div>
  <span style="font-family: Arial;">In the recent SASCOM Magazine, Ted Cuzzillo published a relatively moderate enty, say, <em><a href="http://www.sas.com/news/sascom/2008q4/feature_analyst.html">The Making of An Analyst</a></em>. This paper is considered the fresh graduates to be an analysts in their first job hunting. </span><span style="font-family: Arial;">Yes, there two posts are more compatible than oppositive. Rajan’s targets are those veteran analysts with years of experience.</span>
</div>
